reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I'll add our voice to those who think Ai Cipressi is the best deal in lodging in Lucca. Our room was comfortable, albeit nothing fancy; our bathroom was gargantuan by Italian standards. The breakfast was standard B&B fare, but was ample and nicely presented - and if you want more, there is a great bakery a couple of doors away. The two brothers who run the place are most helpful. It is just outside the walls of the old city at Porta Elisa, but a quick and pleasant stroll into town. It is easy to find once you realize it does not front onto the street (which is probably good for keeping the noise down.) It is a bit of walk from the bus and train stations. We will definitely stay at Ai Cipressi when we return to Lucca.
reviews.title: Great value in Lucca

reviews.text: Four of us enjoyed the wonderful apartment in the central part of Lucca within the walls. It is separate from the B & B and very comfortable and convenient. We used bikes from the B & B and loved all the shopping, sites and leisurely strolls throughout the city. It was a terrific place to make day trips to Barga and Viarregio. We had a great time and really found our apartment comfortable and well supplied.
reviews.title: Enjoyed the apartment inside the walls of Lucca

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband & I just returned from our Tuscan vacation & spent three nights at Ai Cipressi, just outside the Via Elisa gates into Lucca. It is a very small B&B, with onsite parking, and not terribly easy to find. We were a little concerned about the neighborhood when we arrived, but it turned out to be just fine.
reviews.title: Ai Cipressi - nice little B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were on the ground floor with a very nice, very clean room. The room was bright & sunny and had a little patio right outside with table & chairs & lots of lemons on the trees. We did not use the tv - who has time when you are in Lucca? Our only issue with the room was the family in the next room. The floors are tile, so their 2 year old child that never stopped talking or crying constantly echoed through our room. It would be nice if the floors were carpeted or had some rugs to soften the noises.
reviews.title: Clean and Comfortable
Good stay at the Ai Cipressi
reviews.text: We did not use the breakfast facilities, and instead had wonderful capuccino & pastry next door at the bakery. Fresh, hot italian pastries, sitting on the sidewalk tables - molto italiano!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just another place to stay. Breakfast was ordinary, no hot or fresh bread (they provided croissants wrapped in plastic bags etc). All the more annoying, it didn't start until 8:30 am, which for us was far too late. We had breakfast in the nearby cafe instead.
reviews.title: Average

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was basic but clean and spacious. It has the usual faux double bed, ie two singles strapped together. The room has poor sound insulation: we could hear the most amazing snoring coming from next door. Also, could've done without the extractor unit/air-con in back of neighbouring hotel rattling 24-7. The minibar was located in the corridor and had high markups. We bought our drinks from the nearby supermarket instead.
reviews.title: Ideal hotel and location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location wise, the hotel is outside but close enough to the wall, though a good 15-20 mins walk from the train station. The surrounding area was neither charming nor interesting; just suburb, but as trade-off perhaps the supermarket was close.
reviews.title: Good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I wouldn't call it a hotel though. Reception hours are limited, 10-12am and 3:30-6pm. No one will be there to help you outside these hours. That said, staff were pleasant, spoke English, and were helpful providing maps and suggestions, and directions.
reviews.title: excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I are just back after spending 4 days in Lucca at the Ai Cipressi.
reviews.title: Peacefull, clean and Convenient

likes.liked: — Convenience and helpful owners and good value

reviews.title: Very good for a medium-length stay
reviews.text: I recently stayed at Ai Cipressi for two weeks while in Lucca on business. Given the state of the U.S. dollar everything in Europe is expensive but this was less expensive than a hotel within the walls of Lucca and very convenient. The room was kept perfectly clean and was very comfortable, airy, and quiet. The breakfast was just right for me, and Daniele and Gabriele were happy to open up the breakfast room in the late afternoon so I could make some coffee or tea on the afternoons when I had to work in the room. I rented one of the bicycles that they offer to their clients; that worked very well and Gabriele very quickly fixed a light that I inadvertently damaged. They were happy to discuss restaurants and excursions. I was also happy that they were willing to speak Italian with me so that I could practice my poor Italian! All in all, a very successful stay, and I plan to go back to the hotel when I'm next in Lucca.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very helpfull staff. Great ideas on local touring,dinning etc. Exceptionally clean surroundings (room and common area). Breakfast good variety and plentifull. Bike rental a bonus. convenient and reasonablly priced.
reviews.title: Fantastic!

reviews.text: K Canada
reviews.title: Lucca and Versilia holidays

reviews.text: We really enjoyed our stay and have recommended the hotel to others. The courtesy and help of the staff were excellent. Would definitely go again.
reviews.title: Very nice, great owners, but not picturesque

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The young brothers who own this place really make it special: they are very nice, helpful and willing to provide advice about Lucca. Our room was very clean and quiet. We enjoyed the breakfast (good for Italy). It's a quick walk to go within the walls of Lucca. However, it's a converted motel - nicely done, but new and lacking character; rather a contrast to how gorgeous the buildings are within the city walls of Lucca. Still, I'm glad we stayed at Il Parco as I was surprised to find found that the "car-less" Lucca actually had lots of traffic and suspect that a place within the city walls may have been a bit noisy.
reviews.title: overpriced motel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spent one night at the Ai Cipressi which is a bed and breakfast run by two brothers.
reviews.title: Godd little Bed and Breakfast
Loved Lucca!
reviews.text: The location is near the city walls and it ideal if you have a car as their plenty of car parks. If you come to Lucca by train then its best that you take a taxi to the hotel (about 10 mins by taxi).

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel rents out bicycles at a very cheap rate which was signifcantly cheaper then any of the places within the city walls.
reviews.title: Another great review...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is about 15 minutes walk from the centre of Lucca and its perfect for those who dont mind not being in the centre of the city or who have a car.
reviews.title: the two brothers ...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved visiting Lucca. It's a beautiful walled city with fewer tourists than other places. It had a wonderful local feel to it. Ai Cipressi was very conveniently located just outside the wall. We had a car and were very grateful to have an easy place to park. There were several nearby grocers, bakeries and other shops without always having to go inside the wall where things were more expensive.
reviews.title: Great Choice for Lucca
